alert.note: Alert for Blount; Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Blount, northwestern Calhoun, Etowah, northern St. Clair and Cherokee Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1027 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Ider to near Little River Canyon National Preserve to Steele to near Dallas. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Oneonta, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Springville, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Centre Municipal Airport, Dallas, Glencoe, Ashville, Ragland, Locust Fork, Ohatchee, Steele, Leesburg, Altoona and Walnut Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Calhoun; Cherokee; Etowah; St. Clair
